required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Increasing Availability of Lower Energy Meals vs. Menu Energy Labelling on Food Choice
clinical_study.official_title: Socioeconomic Position and the Impact of Increasing Availability of Lower Energy Meals vs. Menu Energy Labelling on Food Choice in Virtual Full-service Restaurants: Two Randomized Control Trials

brief_summary.textblock: Two randomized control trials examining human food choice (i.e. selection of high energy 'unhealthy' foods vs. selection of healthier foods). Interventions: In a between-subjects design, participants (recruitment stratified by socioeconomic position) made food choices (main dish, plus optional sides and desserts) in the absence vs. presence of menu energy labelling and from menus with baseline (10%) vs. increased availability (50%) of lower energy main dishes. Main outcome measures: Average energy content (kcal) of main dish chosen and average total energy content of all food ordered, including optional sides and desserts.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 15-20 minutes (the time frame denotes time taken to make the menu order and there is no follow up
primary_outcome.description: Total kcal content of main menu order

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15-20 minutes (the time frame denotes time taken to make the menu order and there is no follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Total kcal content of all food ordered (including sides, desserts)

arm_group.description: Energy labelling provided on restaurant menus
No energy labelling provided on restaurant menus

arm_group.arm_group_label: Increased availability of lower energy meals
arm_group.description: Higher proportion of meals are 600kcals or less

arm_group.arm_group_label: Baseline availability of lower energy meals
arm_group.description: Proportion of meals that are 600kcals or less at baseline level

intervention.description: Restaurant menus are altered to accommodate energy labelling intervention
intervention.arm_group_label: Increased availability of lower energy meals

intervention.intervention_name: Menu configuration (more lower energy options added)
intervention.description: Restaurant menus are altered to include more lower energy options
intervention.arm_group_label: Increased availability of lower energy meals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants were eligible to participate if they were US residents, aged of 18 or above, fluent in English, had access to a computer with an internet connection and had no dietary restrictions
Exclusion Criteria:
- See above.
Stratification Criteria:
- We aimed to recruit a sample stratified by gender (approx. 50/50) and highest educational qualification (approx. 40% high school or less, 60% above high school) to be broadly representative of US adults.

patient_data.ipd_description: Shared on the Open Science Framework
